snippet: At a hearing with state lawmakers, the new leader of the agency, Steven Santoro, called the issues “unacceptable” and pledged improvements....
abstract: New Jersey Transit executive director Steven Santoro reveals to state lawmakers that federal investigation has illuminated numerous safety violations by railroad workers, including failure by train crews to properly test brakes, and use of personal phones while on duty; saying findings are unacceptable, Santoro announces policy of unannounced inspections and increase in penalties for workers found in violation of safety rules.
lead_paragraph: At a hearing with state lawmakers, the new leader of the agency, Steven Santoro, called the issues “unacceptable” and pledged improvements.

headline.main: Federal Investigation of New Jersey Transit Finds Numerous Safety Violations
headline.print_headline: Federal Investigation of New Jersey Transit Finds Numerous Safety Violations
